Cloud Native Catalog

Easily import any catalog item into Meshery. Have a design pattern to share? Add yours to the catalog.

×

Meshery UI

Meshery CLI

1. Apply a pattern file.

mesheryctl pattern apply -f [file | URL]

Copy to clipboard

2. Onboard an application.

mesheryctl app onboard -f [file-path]

Copy to clipboard

3. Apply a WASM filter file.

mesheryctl exp filter apply --file [GitHub Link]

Copy to clipboard
Patterns
Service mesh patterns enable the business function in simple language.
Filters
Embedded in the data plane of a service mesh, WebAssembly filters offer fine-grained control over service requests.
Programs
Embedded in the data plane of a service mesh, eBPF programs performant, fine-grained control over service requests.
Policies
Applied across the cloud native infrastructure under management, policies may be applied broadly and specificly.

MESHERY001
Deployment

Related Patterns

Deployment
IstioInstallationForCatalogCop
MESHERY000

Basic Istio Install

What this pattern does:

A demo configuration designed to showcase Istio functionality with modest resource requirements. It is suitable to run the Bookinfo application and associated tasks. This is the configuration that is installed with the quick start instructions.

Caveats and Consideration:

Not a suitable production deployment configuration.

Compatibility:

Copy to clipboard

Resiliency

Circuit Breaker

MESHERY002
Resiliency

Related Patterns

Circuit Breaker

What this pattern does:

Circuit breaking is a foundation pattern designed to remove endpoints that persistently return error messages from a load-balanced group. Circuit Breakers go hand in hand with the retry pattern; while a retry attempts to recover from an endpoint returning an error when the system knows an endpoint is failing, a circuit breaker ensures that it is no longer called.

Caveats and Consideration:

If the specific fault reported is unusual or rare, it might have been caused by unusual circumstances such as a network packet becoming corrupted while it was being transmitted. In this case, the service mesh could retry the failing request again immediately because the same failure is unlikely to be repeated and the request will probably be successful.

Compatibility:

Traffic Management

Local Rate Limiter

MESHERY003
Traffic Management

Related Patterns

Traffic Management
Duration-based Canary
MESHERY004

Local Rate Limiter

What this pattern does:

Local rate limiting is used to limit the rate of requests per service instance. Local rate limiting can be used in conjunction with global rate limiting to reduce load on the global rate limiting service.

Caveats and Consideration:

Envoy supports local rate limiting of L4 connections and HTTP requests. This allows you to apply rate limits at the instance level, in the proxy itself, without calling any other service.

Compatibility:

Traffic Management

Duration-based Canary

MESHERY004
Traffic Management

Related Patterns

Traffic Management
Local Rate Limiter
MESHERY003

Duration-based Canary

What this pattern does:

Gradual and measured introduction of a new version of an application is commonly called a Canary deployment. With a canary deployment, you deploy a new version of your application to the production environment; however, it initially receives no user requests. The previous version continues to handle 100% of the requests.

Traffic is gradually distributed to the new version of the service while monitoring it for errors or anomalies. Incremental increases to the new serviceâ€™s traffic continue until the new service handles 100% of all traffic, and you remove the previous service version. If you detect unsatisfactory levels of errors at any point, traffic is reverted to the old version. Because the service meshes routing later handles traffic direction, it is incredibly quick to change the traffic flow. Also, there is a dramatic reduction to risk as you hopefully catch any errors before exposure to the problem affects all users.

Caveats and Consideration:

Parallel Change

When introducing a new version of an application into production, you are often required to:

- Change or modify the applicationâ€™s behavior.
- Change the interface.
- Change a model in an external data store.

Compatibility:

Troubleshooting

MESHERY000

Istio-ready SPIRE

What this pattern does:

Caveats and Consideration:

wasm filter

HTTP Auth

FILTER001
wasm filter

Related Patterns

wasm filter
TCP-Metrics
FILTER002

HTTP Auth

What this pattern does:

Simulates handling authentication of requests at proxy level. Requests with a header token with value hello are accepted as authorized while the rest unauthorized. The actual authentication is handled by the Upstream server. Whenever the proxy recieves a request it extracts the token header and makes a request to the Upstream server which validates the token and returns a response.

Caveats and Consideration:

[Coming Soon]

Compatibility:

Copy to clipboard
wasm filter

TCP-Metrics

FILTER002
wasm filter

Related Patterns

wasm filter
HTTP Auth
FILTER001

TCP-Metrics

What this pattern does:

Collects simple metrics for every TCP packet sent, and logs it down.

Caveats and Consideration:

[Coming Soon]

Compatibility:

Copy to clipboard
wasm filter

TCP-Packet-Parse

FILTER003
wasm filter

Related Patterns

wasm filter
HTTP Auth
FILTER001

TCP-Packet-Parse

What this pattern does:

Parses the contents of every TCP packet the proxy receives and logs it.

Caveats and Consideration:

[Coming Soon]

Compatibility:

Copy to clipboard
wasm filter

Singleton-HTTP-Call

FILTER004
wasm filter

Related Patterns

wasm filter
HTTP Auth
FILTER001

Singleton-HTTP-Call

What this pattern does:

The filter is responsible for intercepting HTTP requests, authorizing them based on the stored cache, and performing rate limiting. In the context of the envoy, this component is an HTTP filter and gets executed in the worker threads. For each request, a context object gets created.

Caveats and Consideration:

[Coming Soon]

Compatibility:

Copy to clipboard
wasm filter

Metrics-Store

FILTER005
wasm filter

Related Patterns

wasm filter
HTTP Auth
FILTER001

Metrics-Store

What this pattern does:

This example showcases communication between a WASM filter and a service via shared queue. It combines the Singleton-HTTP-Call and TCP-Metrics examples. The filter collects metrics and enqueues it onto the queue while the service dequeues it and sends it to upstream server where it is stored.

Caveats and Consideration:

[Coming Soon]

Compatibility:

Copy to clipboard
wasm filter

Singleton-Queue

FILTER006
wasm filter

Related Patterns

wasm filter
HTTP Auth
FILTER001

Singleton-Queue

What this pattern does:

An example which depicts an singleton HTTP WASM service which does an HTTP call once every 2 seconds.

Caveats and Consideration:

[Coming Soon]

Compatibility:

- Change the interface.
- Change a model in an external data store.
